text:
Alexander Armstrong was a Pointless answer on Pointless – and he was absolutely stunned 
The quiz host was flattered at being a top answer on his own TV show Thursday 19 January 2017 14:21 BST Click to follow Per Mertesacker agrees one-year Arsenal extension worth £70,000 a week 
Hit BBC quiz show Pointless took a turn for the self-referential in an episode aired on Wednesday January 18 when host Alexander Amstrong turned out to be a Pointless answer himself. 
In a round where players were asked to name one of the top 40 best-selling albums of 2015, contestant Linda guessed that Armstrong himself would appear on the list for his debut record A Year of Songs. 
“Am I allowed to say Alexander Armstrong?” she asked the host. 
He seemed uncertain as he replied: “I’d be very flattered, but I… aw that’s nice of you! I’d be very surprised. Is that what you’re going to say? (BBC) 
As it turned out, Linda was not only correct – but the answer was one that nobody else in a survey of 100 people named. 
As the counter hit 0, Armstrong exclaimed: “Ah, that’s so exciting! That’s a Pointless answer! 
“That has taken me…the wind out of my… I had no idea! I didn’t know that. Top 40?” The biggest and best TV shows of 2017 The biggest and best TV shows of 2017 1/4 Sherlock, Series 4
